definition: to hold firmly, not let go
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful

sentences.english: Catching each other's eyes glinting in the night, they held their cane knives and machetes with tight fists.
sentences.chinese: 每個人的眼裏都閃着光芒，雙拳緊握甘蔗刀和大刀。

sentences.english: He lacdfds. com on his back, his teeth set, his right hand clenched on his breast.
sentences.chinese: 他仰臥着，牙關緊閉，右手緊握着拳頭胸口上。

sentences.english: Grasp chart with thump and forefinger and pull straight up.
sentences.chinese: 用拇指和食指緊握原表，在垂直向上拉。

sentences.english: He grasped pvp both my hands.
And as they walked they were holding hands, actually clasping hands.
sentences.chinese: 當他們走到他們手牽着手，實際上緊握手中。

sentences.english: When she had gone I began to walk up and down the room, clenching my fists. My aunt said
sentences.chinese: 她走後我開始在房間裏徘徊，緊握雙拳。

sentences.english: The two advanced on him with clenched fists.
sentences.chinese: 這兩人緊握拳頭向他進逼過來。

sentences.english: We gripped the sides of the boat as the waves tossed us about.
sentences.chinese: 那船顛簸得好厲害，我們只好緊握船舷。
這兩人緊握拳頭向他進逼過來。

sentences.english: The eagle is clasping arrows in its other claw.
sentences.chinese: 在另一隻鷹爪裏緊握着箭。

sentences.english: The boy grasped his mother's hand firmly.
sentences.chinese: 那個小男孩緊握住媽媽的手。

sentences.english: He lay on his back, his teeth set, his right hand clenched on his breast .
sentences.chinese: 他仰臥着，牙關緊閉，右手緊握着拳頭放在胸口上。

sentences.english: Interlace your fingers to create a solid grip.
We hold hands, look up to happiness.
sentences.chinese: 皒們緊握雙掱，仰望幸福。

sentences.english: I awoke and saw that I was holding too hard against my chest, the shell of a turtle.
sentences.chinese: 我醒來，看到我貼近胸膛緊緊握着龜殼。

definition: to raise one's head/to perk up
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
